src:
King om scoringen: - Ekstra spesiell
Joshua King (27) forteller at scoringen som senket Manchester United, var spesiell for ham personlig.
02 Nov 2019, 15:29 by Christian M. Hugsted (I England)

Bournemouth - Manchester United 1-0

BOURNEMOUTH (Dagbladet): Etter tre kamper uten nettkjenning kunne Joshua King og resten av Bournemouth-laget endelig juble for scoring.
Og målet som senket Manchester United var også av den spesielle sorten. King fikk tid til å ta ned ballen på brystet, vippe den elegant opp til seg selv over oppasser Aaron Wan-Bissaka, for så å hamre ballen i nettmaskene på volley.
- Det er ekstra spesielt for meg. Det er min tidligere klubb og noen av de er tidligere lagkamerater, også har Ole vært manageren min. Det er spesielt for meg personlig, men for laget handlet det om at vi tok de tre poengene og nå fokuserer vi på kampen mot Newcastle, sier King i pressesonen etter kampen.
King forteller at han ikke har sett sin egen scoring i reprise etter kampen.
- Jeg var rolig og et var en god, ren avslutning. Jeg har ikke sett repriser av det, så jeg ønsker ikke å kommentere det for mye. Men etter det jeg husker var det en grei avslutning, sier King.

Bournemouth har gått fra å være et lag som både skaper og slipper til mye sjanser, men den siste tiden har de vært mer disiplinerte og blant annet spilt to målløse kamper på rad.

- Vi har ikke skapt så mange sjanser, men i dag gjorde vi det. Jeg synes at vi kunne straffet dem enda mer i dag. Men vi tok de tre poengene, og må ta med oss selvtillit inn i den neste kampen. United har vært i god form i det siste, men vi klarte å bryte dem ned, sier King om kampen.
Etter å ha svart pliktoppfyllende på spørsmålene til engelske journalister, velger King å ikke svare på noen spørsmål på norsk - men haster i stedet tilbake i garderoben.
Banens baste var det imidlertid lagkamerat Nathan Aké som ble kåret til.
text:
King about the score: - Extra special
Joshua King (27) says that the score that lowered Manchester United was special to him personally.
02 Nov 2019, 15:29 by Christian M. Hugsted (In England)

Bournemouth - Manchester United 1-0

BOURNEMOUTH (Dagbladet): After three unbeaten matches, Joshua King and the rest of the Bournemouth team were finally able to cheer for scoring.
And the goal that lowered Manchester United was also of a special kind. King was given time to take the ball down his chest, tilt it elegantly to himself over keeper Aaron Wan-Bissaka, and then hammer the ball into the net masks on volley.
- It's extra special to me. It's my former club and some of them are former teammates, also Ole has been my manager. It's special to me personally, but for the team it was about taking those three points and now we're focusing on the match against Newcastle, ”King said in the press zone after the match.
King says he has not seen his own scoring in reprise after the game.
- I was calm and it was a good, clean ending. I haven't seen any replays of it, so I don't want to comment too much. But after what I remember, it was a happy ending, ”says King.

Bournemouth has gone from being a team that both creates and loses a lot of chances, but lately they have been more disciplined and played two matchless games in a row.

- We haven't created so many chances, but today we did. I think we could punish them even more today. But we took the three points and must bring our confidence into the next match. United have been in good shape lately, but we managed to break them down, King says of the match.
After answering dutifully to the questions of English journalists, King chooses not to answer any questions in Norwegian - but urgently returns to the locker room.
However, the team was named teammate Nathan Aké.
